item.title: Overhanging vegetation becoming a hazard, 18th December
item.description:
There are two problems here which have continue to worsen for months. The first is overhanging vegetation. Anyone over about 4Â½ feet tall cannot pass this without endangering their face, particularly in the dark or if blind. The second is prickly hedging encroaching on the pavement, making it difficult to pass between that and parked cars, particularly if pushing a pram or similar.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2A, Parkhurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still remains unpruned since summer., 18th December
item.description:
Good morning. I have contacted you on a couple of occasions regarding the said tree and you (Bexley Council) contacted me in October to tell me this tree was being cut/pruned in the following 2 weeks. I was told if someone didn't come could I contact you and let you know. I gave it a month or so and still noone came to do any work, so I contacted you. Since that ladt report in Novdmber I haven't heard from anyone and I have seen my request/report has been actioned as 'Duplicate request'

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking Lines, 18th December
item.description:
The parking bays in The Memorial Hall Petts Wood Road can barely be seen so making parking difficult (especially with the leaves). The bays on Bluston Parade are the same.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowth of vegetation from neighbouring business park, 18th December
item.description:
There's an overgrowth of ivy obstructing half of the pavement. When pushing a pram, if someone is coming from the opposite direction then one of the parties needs to give way to allow the other to proceed as there's not enough remaining room on the pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Charteris road, 18th December
item.description:
North side of Charteris Road just west of Hazelmere the hedges are taking up a lot of the pavement Mekong it extremely narrow to pass there. Needs to be taken way back. Dale issue on Hazelmere between Charteris and Esmond on the west side of the street, closer to Esmond .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London
